IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The East Meets West Foundation, in conjunction with Reach Vietnam, transforms the health, education and communities of disadvantaged people in Southeast Asia by building partnerships, developing opportunities and creating sustainable solutions.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The East Meets West Foundation, in conjunction with Reach Vietnam, transforms the health, education and communities of disadvantaged people in Southeast Asia by building partnerships, developing opportunities and creating sustainable solutions.
IRS990.Description: GOOD HEALTH:Breath of Life (BOL) provides durable medical equipment and training to hospitals to treat newborns suffering from respiratory distress and jaundice in Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos and East Timor.The Dental program provides free dental care to poor children in central Vietnam. Treatment is provided by staff and volunteers at the Da Nang clinic and on outreach trips to rural areas.See also Schedule OOperation Healthy Heart/Trai Tim Cho Em raises fund to provide surgery and other interventions for poor children in Vietnam with congenital heart defects. The program also strengthens cardiac care capacity with equipment and training.The Support Network for People with Disabilities (SN-PWD) provides comprehensive support for disabled people by creating channels of medical, educational and vocational assistance, including community rehabilitation centers, scholarships, and job training.Life Is Beautiful - Agent Orange is a media campaign to raise awareness about people with disabilities in Vietnam and to raise funds for organizations that provide services to and advocate for them

Activity2.Description: EDUCATION:The Scholarship Program to Enhance Literacy and Learning (SPELL) provides funding for scholarships for children from the poorest 10% of Vietnam's families. Support through high school graduation includes schools fees, supplies and tutoring.The Village of Hope (VOH) provides shelter, education and vocational training for children from disadvantaged backgrounds, including those with hearing impairments. See also Schedule OThe Kon Ray Ethnic Minority Boarding School provides housing and education to ethnic minority and disabled lower secondary school children to improve regional school promotion rates. The program also supports an early childhood care and education (ECCE) component that renovates preschools and trains teachers.The School Construction program replaces run-down primary schools with new facilities to increase access to education in rural areas of Vietnam.The Compassion Homes program builds sturdy, storm-resistant houses for deeply impoverished families in Vietnam.The Upper Secondary Education program (GPOBA) provides three-year need/ability-based scholarships and tutoring to students entering upper secondary school.The Digital Bridges IT Education program provides computer training to prepare post-secondary education Vietnamese students to be systems administrators.One Vietnam is a global online network for the Vietnamese community to allow people to connect with each other and support causes through social media.

Activity3.Description: CLEAN WATER:The Clean Water and Sanitation program improves the quality of life for people in Vietnam and Cambodia by building village and school water systems to increase access to clean safe water. The program promotes latrine building and hygienic behaviors, and ensures access to the water system for the very poorest residents

ActivityOther.Description: EMW replaces run-down primary schools and kindergartens with new, ventilated, sanitary and well-lit facilities to provide a safe environment, conducive to learning, for children in imporverished rural areas of Vietnam. The Early Care Childhood Education program provides teacher training and learning materials to preschool classrooms to help prepare students for primary school. In 2009, a five-classroom primary school and a two-classroom kindergarten were built--the first local schools with enough capacity to provide students with full-day school sessions--benefiting over 250 children. In addition, an administration building was added to an already existing school, providing teaching staff a comfortable and pleasant area for working.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: As of July 1, 2007, the Foundation adopted the Accounting Standards Codification 740, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes. This standard addresses the accounting for uncertainties in income taxes recognized in an entity's financial statements and prescribes a threshold of more likely than not for recognition and derecognition of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in the tax returns. The Accounting Standards Codification 740 also provides related guidance on measurement, classification, interest and penalties, and disclosure. There was no material impact to the Foundation's financial statements as a result of the adoption of Accounting Standards Codification 740.

AcctsActvsOutUSTable.SpecificServicesProvided: Scholarship, heart surgeries, Boarding School, Ecol.Garden

Form990ScheduleFPartV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants Outside the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleFPartV.Explanation: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2: The organization requires the grantee to submit adequate receipts and quarterly reports for the use of grant funds. In addition, regular site and program visits are also conducted by the organization.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CFO, Finance and Audit Committees review the 990, a copy of 990 will be forwarded to all Board Members.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The standard of behavior at the East Meets West Foundation (EMW) requires that all staff, volunteers, and board members scrupulously avoid conflicts of interest between the interests of EMW on the one hand, and personal, professional, and business interests on the other. This includes avoiding potential and conflicts of interest, as well as perceptions of conflicts of interest. All members understand that the purposes of the policy are to protect the integrity of EMW's decision - making process, to enable our constituencies to have confidence in our integrity, and to protect the integrity and reputations of volunteers, staff and board members. Upon or before election, hiring or appointment, members will make a full, written disclosure of interests, relationships, and holdings that could potentially result in a conflict of interest. EMW has a conflict of interest policy and all board memebers and relevant employees are required to sign it. A written disclosure will be kept on file and members will update it as appropriate. In the course of meetings or activities, members will disclose any interests in a transaction or decision where members (including business or other nonprofit affiliations), family, a significant other, employer or close associates will receive a benefit or gain. After disclosure, affected members understand that they will be asked to leave the room for the discussion and will not be permitted to vote on the question.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Compensation Committee reviews and recommends the President's pay to the Board. The Board approves the President's pay. The President reviews and recommends key employee's pay. The Compensation Committee approves key employee's pay.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CFO, Finance and Audit Committees review the 990, a copy of 990 will be forwarded to all Board Members.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are available upon request. The financial statements are posted on the EMW's website, www.eastmeetswest.org
The organizations financial statements were audited by an independent account prior to preparing the tax return.
